alert.note: Alert for Knott; Lee; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 12:25PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Owsley, northwestern Perry, northwestern Knott, Breathitt, southeastern Magoffin and southeastern Lee Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Frozen Creek to Houston to Major. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jackson, Sebastian`s Branch, Houston, Fivemile, Keck, Turkey, Frozen Creek, Elkatawa, Sewell and Gentry around 1230 PM EDT. Canoe, Noctor, Talbert, Inverness, Quicksand, Dumont and Crockettsville around 1235 PM EDT. Haginsville, Portsmouth, Smith Branch and Curt around 1240 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Whick, Little, Saldee, Press, Wilstacy, Copland, Stevenson, Wolf Coal, Howard Creek, Altro, Sikes, Morris Fork, Valjean, Rousseau, Barwick, Guage, Lost Creek, Chavies, Whoopflarea, Dalesburg, Watts, Lunah, Camp Lewis, Clayhole, Lamont, Buckhorn, Ned, Beech, Daisydell, Gays Creek, Lambric, Buckhorn Lake S.P., Rowdy, Dice and Hardshell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
